description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b7tu9","text":"This protocol is an adaptation of Xin \u0026 Chen (2012) and Arseneau et al. (2017). From the high salt suspension step, users can follow Xin \u0026 Chen (2012) protocol to completion for quick clean-up in a 96-well format. If there is no access to or desire for bead-based cleanup, users can follow the protocol outlined by Arseneau et al. (2017) for the DNA pellet and washing steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":324,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8vsa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14pam","text":"It is suggested for use with less than ideal samples (mature fresh leaf with high secondary metabolites, field collection silica dried young leaves, oven-dried leaves). Young Mimulus leaf material generally passes in-house QC using a high salt + CTAB method. I recommend starting with Yuan \u0026 Sweigart (2019) or Fishman (2020) Mimulus protocols on Protocol.io and then trying this protocol for challenging samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb8cq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgj65","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42qp2","text":"This protocol is designed for individual tube format. Users can comfortably complete 96 samples in 3 days using a stacked method (Day 1 Extract, Day 2 Extract/Purify, Day 3 Purify/Quantify). 96 samples are possible in a 2-day format.  The volumes are adapted to make this process efficient, utilizing individual tubes (the use of a combi tip during washes and a larger aqueous phase to draw from during organic phase separation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rekn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rpto","text":"Populations with higher trichome density or purple hue (pigmentation) in leaves were observed to be more challenging to extract cleanly using a standard CTAB protocol in my hands. This protocol was able to handle these samples, along with 2-year-old oven-dried mature leaf tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca1k2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ra3a","text":"Modifications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ds5","text":"CTAB-DNA complex incubation time is increased to 2 hours, including a cool-down step meant to flocculate the complexes. This can be shortened to 1 hour, depending on your sample. Once the solution begins to precipitate CTAB-DNA complexes, it is fine to begin the spin. High-yielding samples are usually ready in 1 hour of incubation. If the sample fails to precipitate after 2 hours, spin anyway, as a small pellet will likely form. In this case, reduce the final elution volume to 35 uL. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ectu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98ful","text":"CTAB-DNA centrifugation is increased (3k rcf → 6k rcf) to stabilize the pellet during decanting (pour-off).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amvnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9v3vb","text":"DNA-CTAB precipitation centrifugation has increased (3k rcf → 10k rcf) before the high salt suspension for higher yields without sacrificing purity. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s38a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rvm9","text":"Two rounds of desalting are used before the final elution. Using one wash yields 260/230 ~ 1.6-2.0, while two washes are generally \u003e2.0. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n16r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b77k3","text":"Average nanodrop 260/280 1.9 + 0.16 , 260/230 2.16 + 0.3 across all 3 tissue types used n = 690.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":29,"length":1},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
